channel.title: Legal Issues
channel.description: Could I get legal issues for making profit with a game heavily based on an existing universe...such as Naruto's?

item.title: Legal Issues
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

Well today I made it official and chose it as my end year’s integration project for school so I will have to start working on it for real.

It will be an RPG game in the universe of Naruto and this project is going to be my contribution to my beloved Naruto series.

I’m looking forward to re-creating the Naruto universe in a game since it is one of my favorite universes.

I will focus this project to be a single-player Android game, with the possibilities of expanding to multi-player and other platforms such as iOS, Windows,… after a successful launch.

I have less than a year time to create a nice solid base for the game because I will have to present it to judges.

Anyway, in this game you’ll have to create an original character, choosing its primary nature affiliation (which will determine which style of jutsu you’ll mainly use in the game), hidden village, gender, the overall physical look, and everything else fundamental to being a ninja in the Naruto universe.

When I actually start working on it I’ll make sure there’s a way for people to follow the progress of the development and be testers for certain aspects.

I’ll make sure to not use any characters of the original series and write my own story for the game.

item.title: Legal Issues
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

MistaBigBoss:

Could I get legal issues for making profit with a game heavily based on an existing universe…such as Naruto’s?

you don’t need to be using any of their content for it to violate copyright, if you use fictional characters or places it could still be grounds for copyright infringement

see: digimon and pokemon, digimon doesn’t use any of the fictional pokemon universe but is arguably a clone, hence pokemon can’t do shit about digimon (and pokemon came first just fyi)

item.title: Legal Issues
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

If you’re using just the ideas, there’s no problem. But using even ONE character could be grounds for a lawsuit (any names or likeness. Naruto Uzumaki, Sasuke Uchiha, etc) Mentioning them in any way could be grounds. Depends on how bad they want to sue you.

item.title: Legal Issues
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

Let’s say the game is heavily based on Naruto’s universe, but has a completely different plot.

e.g. it respects the idea of hidden villages, kages, fudal lords, ninjutsu, taijutsu, genjutsu, dojutsu, genin, chunin, jonin, missions for villages, chakra,…

There’s no way they have a patent for the above, as they are just ideas that existed before Naruto.

The plot in an RPG game (possibly MMO after a successful single player version) is not as important because the player takes the roll of a complete new character.
